name: Shadow
description: You have the power to Execute. Whenever any other player's color or a special destiny card that targets another player is drawn from the destiny deck, use this power to choose one of that player's ships from any colony of your choice and send it to the warp. On a wild destiny card, you may execute one ship belonging to any other player regardless of whom the offense chooses to encounter.
lore: After being subjected to colonial domination for thousands of years, a hive of Shadows rose up on an outpost planet in a forgotten empire. Devoted to guerilla warfare and adept at choosing the most isolated and vulnerable targets as their victims, they mercilessly cleansed their sector of its overlords. Having become imperialists themselves, however, they now have new uses for their old talents.

wild.description: As the defense, when you lose an encounter in which your opponent played an attack card, you may send one of your ships not in the encounter to the warp to take all opposing ships to the warp with you. In spite of winning, those ships do not establish colonies.

super_flare.description: When you execute a ship during your turn, you may replace it with one of your ships, retrieved from the warp.

retooled_gameplay: FFG's Shadow adds text to define how it works with wild and special destiny cards (which did not exist in Eon). Eon's Wild Assassin did not require sending a ship to the warp to use the effect.
edits: Edited to fix the attack bug and to prevent Wild Shadow from incorrectly referring to a planet that may not be yours as "your planet," as well as to avoid problems with effects like Winner and (perhaps someday) moons.
